channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Minnesota Olympians, other athletes speak up about federal agents in Minneapolis
item.description: "I want to make sure you know who I'm racing for," wrote Minnesota-born cross-country skiing star Jessie Diggins. Meanwhile, a hospitality center for Team USA families dropped the name "Ice House."
item.content:encoded:
"I want to make sure you know who I'm racing for," wrote Minnesota-born cross-country skiing star Jessie Diggins. Meanwhile, a hospitality center for Team USA families dropped the name "Ice House."

(Image credit: Matthias Hangst)
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: What we know about the contents of the recent release of Epstein files
item.description: More than 3 million newly-released pages of the Epstein files show more about the life and relationships of convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. They also contain unredacted names of his accusers.
item.content:encoded: More than 3 million newly-released pages of the Epstein files show more about the life and relationships of convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. They also contain unredacted names of his accusers.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: How state officials are taking action against federal agents
item.description: In the wake of Minnesota, several Democratic-led states are looking for ways to limit immigration agents' activities. Some Republican-led states are ordering local governments to cooperate with them.
item.content:encoded: In the wake of Minnesota, several Democratic-led states are looking for ways to limit immigration agents' activities. Some Republican-led states are ordering local governments to cooperate with them.
item.dc:creator: Mawa Iqbal

item.title: Epstein survivor committed to transparency despite redaction problems in files
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow talks with Annie Farmer, one of Jeffrey Epstein's victims, about what may be in the final release of the Epstein files by the Department of Justice.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Detrow talks with Annie Farmer, one of Jeffrey Epstein's victims, about what may be in the final release of the Epstein files by the Department of Justice.
item.dc:creator: Jonaki Mehta

item.title: Trump administration sued over visa freeze on immigrants from 75 countries
item.description: A group of nonprofit organizations and U.S. citizens Monday filed a lawsuit challenging the Trump administration's sweeping suspension of immigrant visa processing for people from nearly half of the world's countries.
item.content:encoded:
A group of nonprofit organizations and U.S. citizens Monday filed a lawsuit challenging the Trump administration's sweeping suspension of immigrant visa processing for people from nearly half of the world's countries.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Vanessa Romo

item.title: The Trump Administration exempts new nuclear reactors from environmental review
item.description: The announcement comes just days after NPR revealed the administration had secretly rewritten safety and environmental standards.
item.content:encoded:
The announcement comes just days after NPR revealed the administration had secretly rewritten safety and environmental standards.

(Image credit: Idaho National Laboratory)
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel

item.title: N.Y. Republican met with jeers over ICE tactics during town hall in swing district
item.description: Discontent over ICE enforcement tactics is spilling out into races across the country, including competitive congressional districts held by Republicans, like Rep. Mike Lawler of New York.
item.content:encoded:
Discontent over ICE enforcement tactics is spilling out into races across the country, including competitive congressional districts held by Republicans, like Rep. Mike Lawler of New York.

(Image credit: Kevin Dietsch)
item.dc:creator: Steve Kastenbaum

item.title: The House races to end shutdown. And, Trump wants to close Kennedy Center for 2 years
item.description: Lawmakers are racing to end a partial government shutdown after Congress missed its funding deadline on Friday. And, Trump wants to close the Kennedy Center for two years for renovations.
item.content:encoded:
Lawmakers are racing to end a partial government shutdown after Congress missed its funding deadline on Friday. And, Trump wants to close the Kennedy Center for two years for renovations.

(Image credit: Aaron Schwartz)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Art critic on the impact the planned closure of the Kennedy Center could have
item.description: NPR's A Martinez speaks with Washington Post art and architecture critic Philip Kennicott about President Trump's plan to temporarily close the Kennedy Center.
item.content:encoded: NPR's A Martinez speaks with Washington Post art and architecture critic Philip Kennicott about President Trump's plan to temporarily close the Kennedy Center.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: Hemp and marijuana are the same species. So why all the different laws?
item.description: Farmers in the U.S. have grown cannabis since the 1600s — but policymakers are still figuring out how to regulate two famous types of Cannabis sativa. A historian calls the plant "incredibly cryptic."
item.content:encoded:
Farmers in the U.S. have grown cannabis since the 1600s — but policymakers are still figuring out how to regulate two famous types of Cannabis sativa. A historian calls the plant "incredibly cryptic."

(Image credit: Nicholas Kamm)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell
